definition:
Two stochastic processes $\lbrace X(t)\mid t\in T \rbrace$ and
$\lbrace Y(t)\mid t\in T \rbrace$ are said to be ** if for *any*
positive integer $n<\infty$, and *any* sequence $t_1,\ldots,t_n\in T$,
the random vectors $\boldsymbol{X}:=(X(t_1),\ldots,X(t_n))$ and
$\boldsymbol{Y}:=(Y(t_1),\ldots,Y(t_n))$ are independent. This means,
for any two $n$-dimensional Borel sets $A,B\subseteq\mathbb{R}^n$, we
have $$P\Big[\boldsymbol{X}^{-1}(A)\cap\boldsymbol{Y}^{-1}(B)\Big]
=P\Big[\boldsymbol{X}^{-1}(A)\Big]P\Big[\boldsymbol{Y}^{-1}(B)\Big].$$
